data.title: Prince recording sessions
data.text:
Bite the Beat

He's So Dull

If a Girl Answers (Don't Hang Up) [recorded March/April 1982]

Nasty Girl

Too Much [unreleased]

1982, 30 March - 6 April - Sessions at Sunset Sound, Hollywood, CA

1982-03-30 Let's Pretend We're Married [released on 1999]

1982-04-01 Wouldn't You Love to Love Me? [not used; released and sung by Taja Seville 1987]

1982-04-03 Extraloveable [unreleased]

1982-04-05 3x2=6 [released on Vanity 6]

1982-04-06 If It'll Make U Happy [released on 1999 Super Deluxe]

1982 mid-April ca - Recording (at Kiowa Trail Home Studio, Chanhassen, MN)

Something in the Water (Does Not Compute) [mixed 28 April at Sunset Sound]

1982, 20 April - 9 May - Sessions at Sunset Sound, Hollywood, CA

1982-04-20 D.M.S.R. [released on 1999]

1982-04-25 Free [released on 1999]

1982-04-27 Raspberry Beret [unreleased; re-recorded for Around The World in a Day]

1982-04-28 How Come U Don't Call Me Anymore [B-side 1999]

1982-05-02 Automatic [released on 1999]

1982-05-09 Delirious [released on 1999]

1982 (between 28 April - early May) Something in the Water (Does Not Compute) [released on 1999]

1982 May-June - Various recordings (at Kiowa Trail Home Studio, Chanhassen, MN)

1982-05-15 Possessed [released on 1999 Super Deluxe]

1982-05-20 Little Red Corvette [released on 1999]

1982-05-22 Purple Music [released on 1999 Super Deluxe]

1982-06-05 Horny Toad [B-side Delirious]

1982-06-05 Yah, You Know [released on 1999 Super Deluxe]

1982 May-June - "THE TIME: WHAT TIME IS IT" sessions (at Kiowa Trail Home Studio, Chanhassen, MN)

777-9311

Grace [B-side 777-9311]

I Don't Wanna Leave You

Onedayi'mgonnabesomebody

1982 Spring/Summer - Various recordings (at Kiowa Trail Home Studio, Chanhassen, MN)

Girl [not used, but remixed in 1985 and released as B-side of America]

Girl o' My Dreams [unreleased]

New Position [unrelesed; re-recorded 17 April 1985 for Parade]

U Should Be Mine [unreleased]

1982, 6-8 July - Sessions at Sunset Sound, Hollywood, CA

1982-07-06 Moonbeam Levels [released on 1999 Super Deluxe]

1982-07-07 Lady Cab Driver [released on 1999]

1982-07-08 Baby You're a Trip [not used; later reworked for Jill Jone; released 2019 on Originals]

1982 Summer - Various recordings (at Kiowa Trail Home Studio, Chanhassen, MN)

1999 [released on 1999]

Boom, Boom (Can't U Feel the Beat of My Heart) [unreleased]

Do Yourself A Favor [released on 1999 Super Deluxe]

My Baby Knows [unreleased]

1982-07-23 No Call U [released on 1999 Super Deluxe]

1982 - Various recordings (at Kiowa Trail Home Studio, Chanhassen, MN)

Fox Trap [unreleased]

Lust U Always [unreleased]

1982-09-07 Irresistible Bitch [1982 Version; unreleased]

Post "1999" / Pre "Purple Rain" LP era:

1982 early November - Videos for "1999" / "Automatic" / "Let's Pretend We're Married"

1982 late - Recording for Vanity 6's planned second album (at Kiowa Trail Home Studio, Chanhassen, MN)

Wet Dream Cousin

1983 early-mid Jan (at Kiowa Trail Home Studio, Chanhassen, MN, USA)

Mia Bocca [late 1982 or early 1983] [re-worked and released in 1987 by Jill Jones]

Wonderful Ass [unreleased; re-worked in 1984]

1983, 7-14 Jan - Sessions at Sunset Sound, Hollywood, CA)

1983-01 7-14 Little Red Corvette (Special Dance Mix) [released on 1999 Super Deluxe]

1983-01 13-14 Drive Me Wild (12" version)

1983-01-14 Electric Intercourse [released on Purple Rain Deluxe]

1983-01-19 - Recording of tour demo (at Lakeland Civic Center, Lakeland FL)

Lady Cab Driver / I Wanna Be Your Lover / Head / Little Red Corvette (Tour Demo) [released on 1999 Super Deluxe]

1983 late Jan - Video for "Little Red Corvette" (at Civic Center, Lakeland, FL, USA)

1983-02-08 - Prince added guitar to Steve Nicks' song "Stand Back" (at Studio 55, Los Angeles, CA, USA)

1983-03-01 - Katrina's Paper Dolls (at Universal Recording Corporation (Studio B), Chicago, during the 1999 tour)

1983-03-14 (estimated) - Strange Relationship (at Kiowa Trail Home Studio, Chanhassen, MN, USA) [unused, but overdubbed and remixed in 1986 and included on Sign O The Times]

1983 26-27 March - "THE TIME: ICE CREAM CASTLE" sessions (at Sunset Sound, Hollywood, CA)

1983-03-26 Jungle Love [released 2019 on Originals]

1983-03-27 My Summertime Thang [unreleased; re-worked and released on Pandemonium]

1983-03-27 Cloreen Bacon Skin [not used; released on Crystal Ball set]

"Purple Rain" LP era:

1983-04-12 (estimate) The Bird (Studio recording) [unreleased] (at Kiowa Trail Home Studio, Chanhassen, MN, USA)

1983 14-22 April - "THE TIME" & "VANITY 6" sessions (at Sunset Sound, Hollywood, CA)

1983-04-14 Proposition 17 [= Chili Sauce] (for The Time)

1983-04-16 If the Kid Can't Make You Come (for The Time)

1983-04-17 Chocolate (for The Time) [out-take; used on Pandemonium]

1983-04-20 Velvet Kitty Cat (intended for Vanity 6, then for Apollonia 6; released on Purple Rain Deluxe)

1983-04-20 My Love Belongs to You [unreleased]

1983 30 April-May - Recordings for Vanity 6's planned second album (at Kiowa Trail Home Studio, Chanhassen, MN, USA)

1983-04-30 Promise to Be True [unreleased; revamped 25 Jan 1987 for use by Bonnie Raitt]

1983-04-30 Sex Shooter [released 2019 on Originals]

1983-05-01 Moral Majority [unreleased]

1983-05 G-Spot [unreleased; re-worked and released in 1987 by Jill Jones]

1983-05 Vibrator [unreleased]

1983 May - Various Purple Rain related recordings (at Kiowa Trail Home Studio, Chanhassen, MN, USA)

1983-05 Modernaire (Dez Dickerson/Prince)

1983-05-18 Let's Get Crazy (Demo) [unreleased]

1983 July - Various recordings (at Kiowa Trail Home Studio, Chanhassen, MN, USA)

1983-07-16 I Know What To Say To You [Prince added vocals to this Stevie Nicks song]

1983-07 late Darling Nikki [released on the Purple Rain]

3 Aug 1983 - Live at St. Louis Park Warehouse, St. Louis Park, MN USA

I Would Die 4 U

Baby I'm a Star

Purple Rain

The basic tracks (more or less shortened) from these live recordings were used for the Purple Rain LP.

7 Aug 1983 - Let's Go Crazy (at St. Louis Park Warehouse, St. Louis Park, MN USA)

8 Aug 1983 - Computer Blue (at St. Louis Park Warehouse, St. Louis Park, MN USA)

Computer Blue # 1 12.29 [features a "hallway speech" by Prince and "Wave your hands in the air"]

Computer Blue # 2 12.29 [lacks all the spoken and sung parts in the middle, but includes a funky guitar]

Computer Blue # 3 11.33 [as version 1, but lacks most of the spoken and sung parts in second part]

Computer Blue # 4 7.23 [edit of version 3]

Sep 1983 - Studio sessions (at Sunset Sound, Studio 3, Hollywood, CA, USA)

1983-09-08 I Am Five [unreleased]

1983-09-15 Irresistible Bitch (re-working of 1982 Version) [released as B-side "Let's Pretend We're Married" 16 Nov 1983]

1983-09-20 The Beautiful Ones [released on the Purple Rain]

4 Oct 1983 - "The Time" Live at First Anenue, MN, USA

The Bird [used in Purple Rain movie + on THE TIME: ICE CREAM CASTLE, 1984]

23-24 Oct 1983 - Studio sessions (at Kiowa Trail Home Studio, Chanhassen, MN, USA)

1983-10-23 Wednesday [unreleased; intended to be sung by Jill Jones in the movie Purple Rain]

1983-10-24 Father's Song [apprears briefly in the movie Purple Rain, and was included on the a test press LP dated 7 Nov 1983]

Nov 1983 - Recordings for Purple Rain

1983-11-01 Shooting of the movie (Purple Rain) commences

1983-11-20 Father's Song (overdubs: piano, synth, bass, guitar etc) [= master take] [released on Purple Rain Deluxe]

1983-11-27 Purple Rain (Wendy & Lisa movie version)

27-31 Dec 1983 - Various recordings (at Sunset Sound - Studio 3, Hollywood, CA, USA)

1983-12-27 The Glamorous Life [intended for Apollonia 6, then for Jill Jones, then Sheila E added drums & vocals in Feb/March 1984 and released it on her album THE GLAMOROUS LIFE']

1983-12-28 Next Time Wipe the Lipstick off Your Collar [intended for Apollonia 6, then Sheila E released it on her album THE GLAMOROUS LIFE']

1983-12-28 Blue Love [unreleased]

1983-12-29 She's Always in My Hair [B-side Raspberry Beret, 1985]

1983-12-31 We Can Fuck [intended for Apollonia 6; re-titled 'We Can Funk' and released slightly reworked on Graffiti Bridge in 1990]

Jan 1984 - Various recordings (at Sunset Sound - Studio 3, Hollywood, CA, USA)

1984-01-05 Oliver's House [released on 'SHEILA E: THE GLAMOROUS LIFE' LP 1984]

1984-01-08 17 Days [B-side When Doves Cry, with Prince's own vocals]

1984-01-11 My Drawers [released on 'THE TIME: ICE CREAM CASTLE' 1984]

1984-01-12 Tricky [B-side Ice Cream Castles]

1984-01-13 Ice Cream Castles [for 'THE TIME: ICE CREAM CASTLE' LP 1984]

1984-01-20 Sugar Walls [recorded for Sheena Easton's 'A Private Heaven' LP 1984]

Jan-Feb 1984 - Recordings for Apollonia 6 (at Sunset Sound - Studio 3, Hollywood, CA, USA)

1984-01-27 Take Me with U [intended for APOLLONIA 6; used for Purple Rain instead]

1984-02-01 Some Kind of Lover [for 'APOLLONIA 6' LP 1984]

1984-02-03 A Million Miles (I Love You) [for 'APOLLONIA 6' LP 1984]

1984-02-03 In a Spanish Villa [for 'APOLLONIA 6' LP 1984]

1984-02-04 Manic Monday [intended for APOLLONIA 6; released and sung by The Bangles]

1984-02-05 Ooo She She Wa Na [for 'APOLLONIA 6' LP 1984]

Feb 1984 - Recordings for Purple Rain movie (at Sunset Sound - Studio 3, Hollywood, CA, USA)

1984-02-07 God (Love Theme from Purple Rain) [used in Purple Rain movie; B-side UK 12" Purple Rain]

1984-02-07 Father's Song [used in Purple Rain movie]

Feb 1984 - Various recordings (at Sunset Sound - Studio 2, Hollywood, CA, USA)

1984-02-10 The Belle of St. Mark [released on 'SHEILA E: THE GLAMOROUS LIFE' LP 1984 with her vocals replacing Prince's]

1984-02-11 Shortberry Strawcake [released on 'SHEILA E: THE GLAMOROUS LIFE' LP 1984]

1984-02-13 Noon Rendevouz [released on 'SHEILA E: THE GLAMOROUS LIFE' LP 1984 with her vocals replacing Prince's]

1984-02-18 Another Lonely Christmas [B-side I Would Die 4 U, 1984]

1984-02-19 Pop Life [released on AROUND THE WORLD IN A DAY, 1985]

1984-02-27 Love and Sex [released on Purple Rain Deluxe]

March-April 1984 - Various recordings (at Sunset Sound - Studio 3, Hollywood, CA, USA)

1984-03-01/02 When Doves Cry [released on PURPLE RAIN]

1984-03-17 Possessed [1984 Version] [released on Purple Rain Deluxe]

1984-03-25 Erotic City [B-side Let's Go Crazy, 1984]

1984-04-15 Blue Limousine [for 'APOLLONIA 6: APOLLONIA 6' LP 1984]

Early May ca 1984 - Various recordings (at Flying Cloud Drive Warehouse, Eden Praire, Minnesota)

Roadhouse Garden [released on Purple Rain Deluxe]

Our Destiny [released on Purple Rain Deluxe]

Strange Relationship

Live 7 June 1984 at First Avenue, Minneapolis

All Day All Night (Live) [released by JILL JONES, 1987]

Late June 1984 - Recordings for The Family/Mazarati (at Flying Cloud Drive Warehouse, Eden Praire, Minnesota)

1984-06-23 Susannah's Pajamas (The Family)

1984-06-24 100 M.P.H. [released/sung by Mazarati, 1986]

1984-06-27 High Fashion (The Family)

1984-06-27 Mutiny (The Family)

1984-06-27 Desire (The Family)

July 1984 - Various recordings (at Flying Cloud Drive Warehouse, Eden Praire, Minnesota)

Early July 1984 12" Remix of Erotic City

1984-07-15 Nothing Compares 2 U [released by The Family 1985; a live Prince version was released 1993; The Original Prince Demo was released 2018/2019]

1984-07-16 Feline [unreleased]

1984-07-23 America [Edit released on Around the World in a Day 1985; full length 21:46 version released on 12" America 1985]

Early Aug 1984 - Various recordings (at Flying Cloud Drive Warehouse, Eden Praire, Minnesota)

1984-08-01 Happy Birthday, Mr. Christian [for APOLLONIA 6, 1984]

1984-08-05 Yes [for The Family]

5 Aug 1984 - 12 Inch Mixes (Prince himself was not involved) (at Sunset Sound - Studio 3, Hollywood, CA, USA)

Sex Shooter (Dance Version) [released as a 12" 31 Aug 1984]

Belle of St. Mark (Dance Remix) [released as a 12" Dec 1984]

Jungle Love [probably a single edit version]

Let's Go Crazy (Special Dance Mix) [released as 12" 29 Aug 1984]

Happy Birthday. Mr. Christian [possibly an extended version which ended up on the LP 1984]

America [unreleased 12" Mix]

Aug 1984 - Various recordings (at Flying Cloud Drive Warehouse, Eden Praire, Minnesota)

1984-08-10 Miss Understood [intended for The Family; unreleased]

1984-08-15 She's Always in My Hair [unreleased version]

1984-08-16 Around the World in a Day [released on AROUND THE WORLD IN A DAY, 1985]

1984-08-17 The Dance Electric [written by Andre Cymone; released on Purple Rain Deluxe]

1984-08-18 The Screams of Passion [released by The Family, 1985]

1984-08-20 God [Vocal] [B-side Purple Rain, 26 Sep 1984]

3 Sep 1984 - Remix session (at Sunset Sound - Studio 3, Hollywood, CA, USA)

1984-09-03 Belle of St. Mark (Dance Remix) [first remixed 5 Aug 1983; this is the second remix session; released as a 12" Dec 1984]

Sep 1984 - Recordings for "Around the World in a Day" (at Flying Cloud Drive Warehouse, Eden Praire, Minnesota)

1984-09-10 Paisley Park [released on Around the World in a Day, 1985]

1984-09-11 She's Always in My Hair (Long Version/New Mix) [B-side 12" Raspberry Beret]

1984-09-12 Raspberry Beret [released on Around the World in a Day, 1985]

1984-09-27 Tambourine [released on Around the World in a Day, 1985]

Oct-Dec 1984 - Various sessions

1984-10-09 Condition of the Heart (at Sunset Sound - Studio 2, Hollywood, CA, USA) [released on Around the World in a Day, 1985]

1984-10-25 I Would Die 4 U (Live Rehersal 25 Oct 1984) (released as a 12" Single 28 Nov 1984)

1984-10-31 The Ladder (at Flying Cloud Drive Warehouse, Eden Praire, Minnesota) [released on Around the World in a Day, 1985]

1984-11-20 I Would Die 4 U (Live 20 Nov 1984) [used for video clip for I Would Die 4 U]

1984-12-07 Temptation (at Capitol Studios, Los Angeles) [released on Around the World in a Day, 1985]

Last update 2021-1221.

This list is largely based on information found on www.princevault.com and, for 1983-1984, the book "Prince and the Purple Rain Era Studio Sessions".
